items.author: James Berardinelli
items.content: Offeris an exhilarating, and occasionally touching, experience that has viewers leaving the theater caught up in an afterglow of wonder. These days, heros like William Wallace are as rare as motion picture displays of this high, uncompromising quality.

items.author: The New York Times
items.content: One of the most spectacular entertainments in years.

items.author: Newsweek
items.content: Looks like a true epic...even if it is both bloody and bloody long.

items.author: Rick Groen
items.content: Despite a formidable effort and occasional grace, there's something cowardly about Braveheart -- it's an aspiring giant with a diminutive soul.

items.author: Sean Means
items.content: Gibson's raw energy and storytelling power in Braveheart are undeniable. If the film doesn't meet his ambitions, it's because he set the bar so high.

items.author: John Hartl
items.content: The graphic battles may grow repetitious toward the end, the final scenes are almost sadistically drawn out, and the script often lacks humor. But this movie moves.

items.author: Los Angeles Times
items.content: Never tries to confuse our loyalties or question the strategies of our hero or bring home the all-embracing soul-destroying horrors of war for all sides. Braveheart may be rip-roaring, but it isn't all that brave.

items.author: Frank Lovece
items.content: A massive, sweaty, frequently silly epic that nevertheless delivers enough brute pleasure to pass a rainy afternoon.

items.author: Richard Schickel
items.content: Braveheart is too much, too late.
